comments:
OS: Windows XP with SP2
Language: English
Build: epf-composer-1.0-M4-N20060718-win32
	    
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new Method Library
2. Create a new Method Configurations
3. Create a new Method Plug-in
4. Create another new Method Plug-in, click File->Close all to save all items
5. Create a new Delivery Process belong to Plug-in A
6. Right click on it, press Move
7. Select Delivery Process of Plug-in B as target
8. Click OK.
   -->Problem: An error window popup with  "Error during move"

Expected Result: The Delivery Process should be moved correctly.

Remarks:
1. The same problem on RHEL4U3(en_US.UTF-8)
2. This is the details error info:

  Error saving file(s)
    org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileIOException: Resource is out of synch and needs to be reloaded: D:\TempWS\plugin1\plugin.xmi
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileSaveUtil.checkOutOfSynch(MultiFileSaveUtil.java:453)
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MethodLibraryPersister$FailSafePersister.adjustLocation(MethodLibraryPersister.java:634)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.edit.command.MethodElementAddCommand$MoveOperation.save(MethodElementAddCommand.java:1768)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.edit.command.MethodElementAddCommand$MoveOperation.access$3(MethodElementAddCommand.java:1751)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.edit.command.MethodElementAddCommand$4.run(MethodElementAddCommand.java:1537)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
Last modified timestamp for newly created plugin is not set and this triggered false alarm about "out of synch"
Verified on build epf-composer-1.0-M4-N20060719-1630-win32, this defect is fixed. Thanks.

traces.message: Resource is out of synch and needs to be reloaded: D:\TempWS\plugin1\plugin.xmi
